quote_a: In my personal life, I would say that keeping my emails more organized would be a huge help, and this would also benefit my professional life.
quote_b: I really haven't looked into any because I don't seem to find the time to pay attention to my own personal email.
explanation: The participant frames email organisation as a hugely important priority yet admits they have not looked into any tools to address it, revealing a gap between stated importance and actual behaviour.

quote_a: I do like it better than having to type it out because I think you get a much faster response, and you can't really delete or take back what you just said.
explanation: The participant reframes an inherent limitation of spoken input (inability to delete or retract words) as a positive quality, suggesting a rationalisation of their preference rather than a straightforward description.
